PracticeTalk Setup Guide

Install and start PracticeTalk.

Open PracticeTalk

What This App Is

PracticeTalk is a speech rehearsal tool. You paste your presentation script (or upload a text file), and it creates spoken audio so you can hear pacing, flow, and transitions before presenting.

  • Input: pasted text or .txt file
  • Output: downloadable speech audio (MP3 or WAV)
  • Controls: voice selection and speaking pace

1. Choose Your Install Method

Recommended: Installer

Download installers from GitHub Releases:

Download macOS installer (.pkg)
Download Windows installer (.exe)

If direct download does not start, open latest release files

This gives you standard app installation and shortcuts.

Portable App

Portable files are also available:

Download portable macOS app (.zip)
Download portable Windows app (.exe)

Just open the app file directly.

2. Install

macOS

  1. Double-click PracticeTalk-mac.pkg.
  2. Follow the installer steps.
  3. Open Applications and launch PracticeTalk.

If blocked by Gatekeeper, right-click the app and choose Open once.

Windows

  1. Double-click PracticeTalk-Setup.exe.
  2. Click through the setup wizard.
  3. Launch PracticeTalk from Start Menu or desktop shortcut.

If SmartScreen appears, click More info then Run anyway.

3. Use PracticeTalk

  1. Launch PracticeTalk.
  2. Your browser opens to http://127.0.0.1:8000.
  3. Paste text or upload a .txt file.
  4. Choose voice, format, and pace.
  5. Click Synthesize and play or download audio.

4. Troubleshooting

  • If the browser does not open, manually visit http://127.0.0.1:8000.
  • If speech generation fails, confirm internet access.
  • If another app is already using port 8000, close it and relaunch PracticeTalk.
